alert.note: Alert for Spencer; Vanderburgh; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 11:44AM EST until February 04 at 11:13PM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Paducah KY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...Kentucky... Ohio River at Newburgh Dam affecting Warrick, Henderson, Spencer, Daviess and Vanderburgh Counties. .Above normal rainfall across the Ohio River basin this month will lead to significant rises over the next week. At Newburgh, river levels are forecast to rise above flood stage on Monday and crest around 41.7 feet next Thursday. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING TO SUNDAY, FEBRUARY 04... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River at Newburgh Dam. * WHEN...From Monday evening to Sunday, February 04. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 25.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 35.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Monday evening to a crest of 41.7 feet Thursday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday, February 04. - Flood stage is 38.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 1245 PM CST.
